page.title: 11EDUCATION IN CRUDEN BAY.
page.content: 180 years ago the Erroll School was opened two miles away from the village. The school was probably out of the village because of farmers', children. 100 years ago people of the village asked the Earl of Erroll to build an Infant school because it was too far for the young children to walk. The Infant School closed in 1904 when Aberdeenshire Education built Port Erroll School. During the 2nd World War the school population doubled because of evacuees. The village children were taken in the morning and the evacuees in the afternoon. The Erroll school closed in 1954. Port Erroll school closed in 1978. Port Erroll new school opened and in 1980 both schools came into use because of increase in numbers.
